intro: Calcitrapa nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrowleaf false foxglove, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Calcitrapa nudicaulis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
